param.name: notebook_dir
param.label: Directory to start Jupyter GUI
param.help: This is the directory that you start with when the JupyterHub graphical user interface starts. The default value here is your home directory.

param.name: conda_install
param.label: Install miniconda if not there?
param.help: Select Yes to install Jupyter in miniconda environment and No to load an existing python environment

param.name: conda_env
param.label: Conda environment (recommended: base)
param.help: Environment to active. The base environment enables changing kernel to other environments!

param.name: load_env
param.label: Command to load Jupyter
param.help: To load the environment, enter the appropriate command, for example: module load module-name or source path/to/env.sh.

param.name: install_instructions
param.label: Select Jupyter Notebook Installation
param.option: Latest default versions of Jupyter Notebook and Python (not thoroughly tested)
Provide custom Conda environment YAML file

param.name: yaml
param.label: Paste Conda Environment Defition YAML
param.help: Copy and paste a custom Conda environment definition YAML file

param.name: password
param.label: Password for notebook session
param.help: Enter password or leave blank for no password

param.name: jobschedulertype
param.label: Select Controller or SLURM Partition
param.help: Job will be submitted using SSH or sbatch, respectively

param.name: _sch__dd_partition_e_
param.label: SLURM partition
param.help: Partition to submit the interactive job. Leave empty to let SLURM pick the optimal option.

param.name: scheduler_directives
param.label: Scheduler directives
param.help: e.g. --mem=1000;--gpus-per-node=1 - Use the semicolon character ; to separate parameters. Do not include the SBATCH keyword.
